page.title: 12Horndon parish Church
page.content: The Parish Church of St. Peter and St. Paul is situated on land between Orsett Road and Mill Lane. The present Vicar is Rev. D. William, who is also the Rural Dean. It has many beautiful features including a wooden belfry built in the 15th Century and a stained glass window. A fund has been set up to collect money for the repair of this window. It has a typical Essex steeple, which dominates the skyline of Horndon from many angles. A lychgate in Orsett Road provides the main entrance. The Church has been vandalised and, unfortunately, is locked except for services or unless somebody in authority is present. At the time of the Feast and Fayre the Church has a beautiful Flower Festival and musical concernt.
